column4: ï»¿joaopinto, I have looked in System monitor, and that shows me the memory for things, and there is nothing using enough(not even everything total) to take up 91% of my memory...
where are you seeing your memory being taken up? Is it in the gnome applet (system monitor applet)?

what you are probably seeing is that most of that memory is being used a temporary storage. It's just there holding recently accessed information so that it doesn't have to look back to the hard drive, or other place for it immediately
I have found that process to be normal on ubuntu machines
